title: Guru Gobind Singh
summary: Guru Gobind Singh ([gʊɾuː goːbɪn̯d̯ᵊ sɪ́ŋgᵊ]; 22 December  1666 – 7 October 1708),[2][8] born Gobind Rai, was the tenth Sikh Guru, a spiritual master, warrior, poet and philosopher. When his father, Guru Tegh Bahadur, was executed by  Aurangzeb,[lower-alpha 1] Guru Gobind Singh was formally installed as the leader of the Sikhs at the age of nine, becoming the tenth and final human Sikh Guru.[13] His four sons died during his lifetime – two in battle, two executed by the Mughal army.[14][15][16]
